Package cz.vse.java.utils.cryptography.hashing

Class Hasher

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.vse.java.utils.cryptography.hashing.Hasher
  • public class Hasher
extends java.lang.Object

    The class of Hasher is used for hashing any String message. Supports hashing with or without salt.

    The salt can be generated from random number (with given length) or using input String.

    The accepted algorithms are defined by HashAlgorithms, which means:

    • none
    • MD5
    • SHA-1
    • SHA-256
    • SHA-384
    • SHA-512
    Do not use 'none' option, because it may be unstable. Written for project "Utils".
    Version:
    07. 02. 2020
    Author:
    Vojtěch Pavlů
    See Also:
    Hash function from Wikipedia, HashAlgorithms

      • Hasher

        public Hasher​(java.lang.String algorithm)
       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Parametric constructor for generating instanece of the Hasher class.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Chosen algorithm. Should not be changed during lifecycle of the instance. Recommended to use the HashAlgorithms class by it's static getInstance() method.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - When the algorithm is not supported.

      • Hasher

        public Hasher​(EHashAlgorithm algorithm)
        Parametric constructor for generating instanece of the Hasher class.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Chosen algorithm. Should not be changed during lifecycle of the instance. Recommended to use the HashAlgorithms class by it's static getInstance() method.

      • Hasher

        public Hasher​(int securityLevel)
        Parametric constructor for generating instanece of the Hasher class.
        Parameters:
        securityLevel - The security level, depending on scale of security defined by sorted algorithms. Minimum value is 0, maximum is 5. Whenever you use other value, it ends up in process in HashAlgorithms class.

      • Hasher

        public Hasher​(java.lang.String algorithm,
              char[] charset)
       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Parametric constructor for generating instanece of the Hasher class.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - Chosen algorithm. Should not be changed during lifecycle of the instance. Recommended to use the HashAlgorithms class by it's static getInstance() method.
        charset - Charset to be used mostly in the 'peppering' and 'depeppering' processes.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - When the algorithm is not supported.

      • Hasher

        public Hasher​(int securityLevel,
              char[] charset)

        Parameters:
        securityLevel - The security level, depending on scale of security defined by sorted algorithms. Minimum value is 0, maximum is 5. Whenever you use other value, it ends up in process in HashAlgorithms class.
        charset - Charset to be used mostly in the 'peppering' and 'depeppering' processes.

        Returns:
        String-formed hashing of the data
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - When there is no such algorithm in supported ones.

      • generateHashWithSalt

        public java.lang.String[] generateHashWithSalt​(java.lang.String data)
                                        throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Method for generating hashing with salt using data only. The salt is gonna be autogenerated with lenght of 20 bytes.
        Parameters:
        data - String data to be hashed
        Returns:
        String-formed hashing of the data
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - When there is no such algorithm in supported ones.

      • generateHashWithSaltAndPepper

        public java.lang.String[] generateHashWithSaltAndPepper​(java.lang.String data,
                                                        int length)
                                                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Method for generating hashing with salt and pepper using data, autogenerated salt and pepper. The length of salt is gonna be 20 bytes, the length of pepper is optional.
        Parameters:
        data - String data to be hashed
        length - length of the pepper The length should not be much longer than 3, because of high computational demand of the validation of hashing with pepper in higher ranks!
        Returns:
        String-formed hashing of the data
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - When there is no such algorithm in supported ones.

                                                      byte[] salt)
                                               throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • checkHashWithSalt

        public boolean checkHashWithSalt​(java.lang.String data,
                                 java.lang.String hashed,
                                 java.lang.String salt)
                          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Checks two hashes using salt only.
        Parameters:
        data - Data to be validated against the hashing. This String is about to be hashed and the 'hashed' value will be compared to the new hashing.
        hashed - Data to be compared against the new hashing build from given data.
        salt - Used salt while hashing the 'hashed' value.
        Returns:
        the boolean value if is or is not valid.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - When there is no such algorithm supported

      • checkHash

        public boolean checkHash​(java.lang.String data,
                         java.lang.String hashed)
                  throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Deprecated.
        The hashing without salt is not secure enough and for this reason should not be used!
        Checks basic hashing against String-formed data input.
        Parameters:
        data - Data to be checked
        hashed - Hashed original data
        Returns:
        boolean value if is or is not valid.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - When there is no such algorithm supported

      • checkHashWithSaltAndPepper

        public boolean checkHashWithSaltAndPepper​(java.lang.String data,
                                          java.lang.String hashed,
                                          java.lang.String salt,
                                          int pepperLength)
                                   throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Checks two hashes using salt and pepper. First of all generates all possible combinations of data with peppers. Than these are hashed and compared to default hashed value.
        Parameters:
        data - Data to be validated against the hashing. This String is about to be hashed and the 'hashed' value will be compared to the new hashing.
        hashed - Data to be compared against the new hashing build from given data.
        salt - Used salt while hashing the 'hashed' value.
        pepperLength - Length of the pepper used while hashing the original value. Should not be much longer than 3
        Returns:
        the boolean value if is or is not valid.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - When there is no such algorithm supported

      • generatePepper

        public java.lang.String generatePepper​(int length)
        Generates all possible variations of peppers by given length. Should not be longer than 3, because of algorithm complexity and multidimensional computing.
        Parameters:
        length - Length of the pepper
        Returns:
        The pepper to be used in hashing with pepper
